subject: Creativity
title: The Four Stages of Creativity: Wallas Model
description: A quick win: understand The Four Stages of Creativity: Wallas Model.

hook.text: In 1926, Graham Wallas described creativity as four stages: Preparation, Incubation, Illumination, Verification.

buildup.text: Preparation is research. Incubation is stepping away. Illumination is the 'aha' moment. Verification is testing.

discovery.text: The key insight: you can't skip Incubation. The unconscious mind needs time to connect dots consciously missed.

twist.text: Most workplaces optimize for Preparation and Verification ‚Äî skipping the two stages where creativity actually happens.

climax.text: Nearly a century later, neuroscience confirms Wallas was right. The default mode network activates during incubation.

punchline.text: The most productive creative step is doing nothing. Deliberately.

quiz.question: Which stage of the Wallas model involves the unconscious mind connecting ideas?
